ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Does he imagine that no one has seen him?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Does he think that no one sees him?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Does he believe that none has seen him?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Does he think that no one has seen him?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Does man think that no one saw him?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Does he think that none sees him
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Does he think that no one sees him?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: What, does he think none has seen him?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Thinketh he that none beholdeth him?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Does he then think that no one sees him?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Deemest he that none beholdeth him?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Does he suppose that no one sees him?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Thinketh he that none beholdeth him?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Thinks he that none sees him?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Does he think that none has observed him?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Does he think that no one sees him?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Does he think that no one has seen him?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [90:7] Does he suppose that (an, in other words, annahu) no one has seen him?, with regard to what he has expended to know the quantity thereof; God knows the quantity thereof; but it is not [in reality that much so as] to be considered a great amount, and [in any case] He will requite him for his evil conduct.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Thinketh he) does the disbelieving man deem (that none beholdeth him) that Allah does not see his deeds whether he spends money or not?
